definition: to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
to move/to shift/to change (a position or location etc)/to promote

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.chinese: 不过，只要彼此互相迁就，还是能相处得不错。

sentences.english: Perhaps the point of water through rock; perhaps, the breeze can be indulged .
sentences.chinese: 也许水通过岩石点，也许，在微风可以姑息迁就。

sentences.english: When a person is ill he may have to be humored .
sentences.chinese: 在一个人生病时，他需要别人迁就他。

sentences.english: His father sometimes indulges in a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 有时迁就生病的孩子是必要的。

sentences.english: He gave her a critical and condescending look-over.
sentences.chinese: 他用迁就的眼光细细地端详了她一下。

sentences.english: Guilt-ridden, parents then indulge their children with gifts and indiscipline .
sentences.chinese: 负疚的双亲用礼物和放松管教来迁就孩子。

sentences.english: The accommodation for the press was makeshift at best.
sentences.chinese: 迁就新闻界充其量只是个权宜之计。

sentences.english: There may be some give-and-take here, with the money and human systems.
sentences.chinese: 薪酬和人力系统之间需要一些互相迁就和妥协。

sentences.english: Unprincipled accommodation will do harm to him.
sentences.chinese: 无原则的迁就对他有害。

sentences.english: Toleration of dishonest officials encourages corruption.
sentences.chinese: 对贪官污吏的姑息迁就就是助长腐败。

sentences.english: As much as we would like to accommodate you, Miss Roffe.
sentences.chinese: 我们是尽可能地通融迁就你的。

sentences.english: It would be foolish not to accommodate the people who will decide who governs.
sentences.chinese: 这将是愚蠢的人不能姑息迁就谁决定谁管理。

sentences.english: We mustn't pass over his mistakes.
The best feeling is that you have to adapt to your mood.
sentences.chinese: 最好的感觉莫过于你闹情绪有人来迁就你。

sentences.english: Paul did not indulge some of my more heterodox economic thinking.
sentences.chinese: 保罗没有过分迁就我某些更显异端的经济学思路。

sentences.english: He humored me and gave me a lesson.
sentences.chinese: 他迁就我说可以，却给了我一个教训。

definition: to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
to pardon/to forgive/to show tolerance/to contain/to hold/inclusive
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
